Configuring the Task Scheduler. Launch of ETL
In this example, the user selects the scheduler type "
Task Scheduler. Launch of ETL
".
After selecting the desired type of scheduler, you need to fill in the following fields:
Setting
Purpose
ETL object
Selecting an ETL object from the drop-down list.
Algorithm for ETL run parameters
Selecting an algorithm from the drop-down list.
In this case, we created:
ETL object that displays information about the minimum wage;
Algorithm that generates ETL start parameters.
The following fields will be filled in automatically by the System:
Setting
Purpose
The last run was successful
Result of running the action. Possible values:
• yes – executed successfully;;
• no – executed unsuccessfully.
Last run date
Date and time of the last run of the action.
When the scheduler configuration is completed, save the data using
. The created algorithm launch scheduler will be presented in the "Task Scheduler" child attribute in the schedule card.
